intro: Ricoila bavarica, commonly known as the Bavarian ricola, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Ricoila bavarica is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its seeds are used in traditional herbal remedies and as a spice in some regional cuisines.
